intro: Sanvitalia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican firecracker, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular, red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Sanvitalia mexicana thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
